name: Hip Two Bedroom in Dundas West!
summary: This is the perfect hideaway for a family or couple looking to explore Toronto together. Tucked away on a cute side street in Little Portugal, it's the private, quiet apartment of your dreams.  Our wifi is fast and the sheets are a luxurious-feeling Egyptian cotton. The loft bedroom is cozy and intimate, while the apartment itself has everything you need to enjoy your stay, from a fully equipped kitchen to laundry. The artwork is a selection of some of our favourite local artists.

The apartment is equipped with everything you need to enjoy your stay, including TV, laundry, a fully equipped kitchen and a cozy living area. If you’d rather not use the kitchen, you’re in luck! The area has great options food options.

neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is located in the heart of Little Portugal, one of the most flourishing neighbourhoods in Toronto's downtown core. Exciting restaurants and bars are opening faster than we can keep track of! One-of-a-kind clothing shops, cafes and entertainment are at your doorstep. We’re located perfectly between High Park to the West and Trinity Bellwoods Park to the East. The nightlife around Dundas and Ossington is a great scene to check out, and only a five-minute walk away!
notes: We want to make sure you love your time in Toronto, so please let us know if there's anything that we can do to make your visit extra-special.
transit: The apartment is literally metres from Dundas Street, which has a streetcar line that will take you clear across the city in both directions. This makes it very easy to get around and see all the best attractions and areas. It’s a short 10-minute walk to Queen Street West, the ultimate place to shop in Toronto.
access: You'll have full access to the space— there are no shared areas.
interaction: We pride ourselves in responding as fast as possible to any guest inquiries (usually five minutes or less). We’re always available if you have any questions about your stay, and as soon as you book, we’ll send along our guest book with great recommendations for things to do in Toronto, as well as all the unit details.
house_rules: - Our Space: please be respectful of our space and treat it as your own.  - No Parties: We want you to enjoy your stay with us as much as possible, but we love our neighbours and want to keep them happy! Low-noise and under control-fun is encouraged. The fine for parties will be an automatic charge equivalent to the security deposit.  - No smoking: the fine for smoking is 300. - No Pets: the fine for pets is 300.

Hope you guys choose my place to stay, next time you're in town!

The Air Canada Centre and Rogers Centre are so close you can almost hear the crowds. Hungry?? No problem! Tons and tons of great food options available, from fine dining to eating on a budget, it's all so very very close. Feel like going to the Harbour front? No problema! The lake is a 15 minute walk from the condo! This location literally has it all! It's also a two minute walk to the Metro Toronto Convention Centre!
notes: Looking for great food and entertainment? Don't sweat, we've got you covered! The building is minutes away from some of Toronto's finest and most talked about restaurants and bars: e11even - Updated American classics in a sophisticated space, plus a 3,200-bottle wine list. They're known for their truffled mac and cheese, lobster mac and cheese, the tuna tartare, and drinks menu, but you MUST try their burgers! One of the best in the city. Azure - Polished hotel lobby restaurant with soaring windows, serving seasonal cuisine morning till night. Boasts private dining rooms, live jazz music and much more. Epic - Upscale dining with seasonal Canadian cuisine with a wine list to write home about. Their sea food chowder, surf and turf and rack of lambs are known around the city! Real Sports Bar - Rated as the best sports bar in Toronto, this place boasts a two-storey, high def screen for your viewing pleasure. If you're not at the game, this is your absolute second best option. These are jus

Grocery stores, movie theater, restaurants, performing Art Center, Toronto library, Finch subway and so much more. Surrounded by million dollar houses. notes: Due to the space in the house, sometimes, there is echo through hallway.  Guests are to be aware of this fact and to be quiet after 10PM. transit: - You can walk to Finch subway station (10 minutes) - 30 minutes to downtown Toronto by public transit  - Two blocks from Yonge Street one of the largest streets in the world - Close to Shoppers Drug Mart, Metro, H-mart, Starbucks, Loblaws, LCBO and many restaurants. - Beautiful Don Valley Park is 10 min away by TTC. - 20 minute drive to Vaughan Mills Outlet and Canada’s Wonderland, the largest amusement park in Canada. It's a 25 min drive from Pearson Airport. There's also an airport shuttle bus called GO, number 34,  leaving from Pearson Airport Terminal 1 every hour. By TTC (Toronto Transit Commission) it takes 1h30min. There are other options like Uber or Taxi which will cost around CAD35 and it takes 30 min from the airport.

host_about:
I used to be an avid graphic designer for a long time in Asia. I enjoy working with houses in Toronto as whole space seems to be a canvas to me. I like being the host and guests on this AirBnB as it is exciting meeting with lots of new people and keep upgrading my place to please the guests and myself. Since I became AirBnB host, I had many wonderful guests. I want my guests to feel home here in Toronto, while they are away from home. 
Over the years of work, I ended up looking after a few other places, even not only my place but also my friends's places as they know I like working with houses. Especially renovating kitchen and washroom is my specialty. I love working with the patterns and colors of tiles.

The Air Canada Centre and Rogers Centre are so close you can almost hear the crowds.  Hungry??  No problem! host_about:
Hey guys!  This business is new to me so be gentle.  I promise that I'll do my absolute best to accommodate your needs as a host.  I take your requests very seriously and respond to them as soon as I possibly can.  I also live about 10 minutes from this condo so if you need me to help you with anything, don't hesitate.

Aside from my apparent graciousness, I love travelling, good food and great music.  My favourite city in the world is Toronto (of course) but NYC is an extremely close second!  Some of my favourite movies are Bravehart, The Departed, Superbad, and Casino.  My favorite music is Jazz, Hippidy Hop, Indie and Latin (I know; mad consistent right?)  

My life motto:  SMILE.  Things are always better when you just smile more.  Not very complicated.  

Hope you guys choose my place to stay, next time you're in town!

notes: Please check with us before doing laundry. We charge 3 per load which includes the use of the washer, dryer, or drying rack, soap and dryer sheets. No shoes or odd items are allowed to be washed in the machines - normal fabric clothing only.

You can go online and order and print a temporary street parking permit from the Toronto City website.  We can help you access it when you arrive if you need. Transit Instructions from Pearson Airport: You can get the Pearson Express train to Union Station for 12. From Union Station, you can take an Uber Taxi for 6-8 or the TTC for 3.25, or you can walk. name: Kensington Place Loft (203C)
summary: Located in a building with multiple units that have undergone recent renovations. Central, downtown Toronto.   Kensington area is full of vibrant culture... there is art and famous graffiti artists everywhere, as well as shops and everything you'd want in a signature Bohemian neighborhood! Kensington has its own aura, people are kind & welcoming. There is fresh produce everywhere. Fresh Cheese shops galore!  Beautiful European bakeries.  Ideal for travelers with a taste for art & culture.
space: Fully renovated building & unit that is modern and comfortable.  The apartment is furnished and stocked with anything you would require. Located deep in Kensington market, surrounded by plenty of street art, some of the best restaurants the city has to offer and the best local produce.  You are centrally located in a most convenient part of the area, close to all the attractions Downtown Toronto has to offer - ROM Museum, CN Tower, Ripley's Aquarium, AGO, Chinatown, etc. Subway stations within walking distance, and two different streetcar routes are one minute away. The spadina streetcar will take you to the CN tower, harbour front, or the opposite direction towards the Bloor subway line. The College streetcar takes you to either Little Italy or Yonge Street.

Lots of shopping at Dufferin Mall and Queen Street is the Fashion District. Trinity Bellwoods Park is just around the corner where many people love to spend their afternoons on a sunny day. The night life is bustling. Bars such as Lula Lounge for a night of Salsa, Lockhart ("The Harry Potter Bar") or Get Well for those who love Craft Beer. There is something for everyone in this area. You will love it here!
notes: We have made the room very comfortable and private, however you more than welcome to enjoy yourself in the open shared areas of the house. summary: Located in a building with multiple units that have undergone recent renovations. Central, downtown Toronto. Ideal for travelers with a taste for art & culture.
space: Fully renovated building & unit that is modern and comfortable.  The apartment is furnished and stocked with anything you would require. You are centrally located in a most convenient part of the area, close to all the attractions Downtown Toronto has to offer - ROM Museum, CN Tower, Ripley's Aquarium, AGO, Chinatown, etc. Subway stations within walking distance, and two different streetcar routes are one minute away. The spadina streetcar will take you to the CN tower, harbour front, or the opposite direction towards the Bloor subway line. The College streetcar takes you to either Little Italy or Yonge Street.

neighborhood_overview: You're in the heart of the Entertainment District, with its glittering theatres, restaurants and nightlife. Just steps away is the renowned TIFF Lightbox, home of the international film festival.  It's a short walk to the Rogers Centre, the Air Canada centre, the CN tower,  Ripleys Aquarium and the CBC building. Within 200 metres is The Path, a vast underground pedestrian precinct connecting businesses, shops, theatres, restaurants and the huge Eaton Centre. A few minutes' walk away is Chinatown, with its fascinating ethnic foods and unique restaurants.  Then there's the Kensington Market, an idiosyncratic blend of funky  shops, indie coffee houses and all manner of dining options. Walk north to City Hall and enjoy the winter skating and the lights. A ten minute walk south brings you to the lakeshore and the newly engineered pedestrian walkway with its coffee shops, restaurants and beaches for warm days or when you feel like a breath of fresh air. A short cab or streetcar ride takes yo
transit: Streetcars and buses stop at the street corner.  The  subway station is on Queen Street about ten minutes away.   Union Station is a seven-minute walk from the condo, with access to Via rail, GO  transit and the UP express which gets you to Pearson airport in 25 minutes. You can walk throughout the downtown core, warn and dry in The Path.  The Path is an extensive underground network offering a great variety of retail therapy, entertainment and dining opportunities and access to the massive Eaton Centre, Toronto's definitive shopping experience!

neighborhood_overview: Located in the prestigious and exclusive Yorkville neighbourhood, 8 Park Road is only a few steps away from one of the most famous intersections in the world and referred to as the heart of Toronto, Yonge and Bloor.  To the west, residents have access to some of the most famous international designer shops, a myriad of restaurants with unrivaled cuisine, a fashionable nightlife, and a variety of cultural activities.  In contrast, a few steps to the east and one can leave the hustle and bustle of the city and walk or jog along the city’s well known nature trails and parks in the Rosedale ravine.   Multi-million dollar homes and stately mansions adorn the ravine. History What is now one of Toronto’s busiest intersections was, in George Brown’s time, green and suburban. But by the 1920s, the area was becoming more popular, thanks in part to Loew’s Uptown Theatre, which began housing both cinema and vaudeville performances that decade. It continued mostly as a single-screen cinema, but aft
notes: History What is now one of Toronto’s busiest intersections was, in George Brown’s time, green and suburban. But by the 1920s, the area was becoming more popular, thanks in part to Loew’s Uptown Theatre, which began housing both cinema and vaudeville performances that decade. It continued mostly as a single-screen cinema, but after a fire gutted the theatre’s main auditorium in 1960, the venue was forced to close. By the end of the decade, a developer had rebuilt the Uptown as one of the world’s first multiplexes, featuring five screens. It spent the 1980s and 1990s as one of the Toronto International Film Festival’s key venues, but in 2001, a dispute closed the theatre’s doors forever and gave way to the construction of a condo. In 1925, Yonge and Bloor’s first traffic signals were installed to allow for a more controlled flow of cars, buses and pedestrians, but it was the 1954 launch of the TTC’s first subway line that truly transformed the area, allowing its residents to reach Eglint
transit: If you need to commute anywhere in the greater Toronto area, the city’s subway hub, at Yonge and Bloor, is literally at your doorstep.  Within a few minutes you can be in the core of the financial district or by the lake, or travel across the city or to the northern limit, all without ever being exposed to the elements.   When you’re at home, you can lounge on the rooftop terrace in a relaxing environment complete with water features and greenery.   In addition to all this, residences are located in a private, safe, and intimate setting, atop a unique and upscale sky lobby perched seven floors above the city.  and Bloor is the central subway station where the North/South and East/West lines meet, allowing you access to all the city has to offer.

name: Designer Studio / Perfect Location
summary: Cute, cozy studio condo with East facing terrace.  Right in the heart of the entertainment district and the best spot in Toronto. The condo itself is well appointed and comes with a fully stocked kitchen in case you get bored with the hundreds of restaurants in the neighbourhood.  The bed is super comfortable and the entertainment system is complete with cable, Netflix, Youtube, a web browser and many other apps.  Also has a sound bar for playing your music from the TV or your phone/laptop.
space: Very cute and cozy studio condo with everything you need.  High quality, firm, bamboo pillow top bed with nice cotton sheets and lots of pillows.  A large dining/work area on a Live Edge dining table.  Fully stocked kitchen with everything you need to cook and a Nespresso machine for your morning coffee (or walk outside the building to the Aroma Cafe).  Small terrace with unobstructed (for now, lol) East views.  Although the bathroom is quite small there is a large shower/tub with great water pressure. We tried to make the entertainment system as full and user friendly as possible too.  Full internet Cable and Roku box, LG 4K Smart TV with Netflix, Youtube, other apps and a web browser with a wireless keyboard so you can surf the web from bed.  There is also a bluetooth sound bar for streaming music from the TV or your phone or laptop.

neighborhood_overview: One of the hottest spots in the city.  Right near the corner of King and Spadina, Located in the heart of the entertainment district.  You can't get any closer to the action in Toronto.  The best restaurants, bars and night clubs are right outside your door.  Walk a couple of blocks in one direction and you're in the Theatre District and the TIFF Lightbox Theatre.  Head North and you're in China Town and Kensington Market.  Head South and you're at the Rogers Centre, Aquarium and the CN Tower.  Not enough, there are N/S and E/W street cars right outside your door.
notes: The crowds and noise often go into the wee hours on the weekend.  The condo is on the 3rd floor and fairly quiet but light sleepers will hear the excitement on the street on Friday and Saturday nights.
transit: Unless you're planning to head further afield or the weather isn't cooperating, everything is a short walk away.  On those snowy or rainy days there street cars that literally stop outside of the building entrance to take you where you need to go.
access: Unfortunately, the amenities in the building (gym/pool) are for residents only.  You will have access to everything in the condo and are welcome to lounge in the comfortable building lobby by the fireplace.
interaction: You have full privacy during your stay but please let me know if you need anything whatsoever.  We're happy to help.

Smoking is permitted on the terrace but use the ashtray provided and do not throw cigarette butts (or anything else) off of the balcony. Parties are not allowed in the condo and no outside guests are allowed without previous approval.  We want to keep the building and our neighbours happy so that we can rent to other great people like you. It takes about 15 minutes to get right downtown into the action or to the airport so it's very convenient for transit. Toronto also offers UberX and UberPool for inexpensive ways to travel with groups.
access: Gusts have access to the entire apartment, there are no shared areas.

house_rules: - 	Our Space: please be respectful of our space and treat it as your own.  - No Parties: We want you to enjoy your stay with us as much as possible, but we love our neighbours and want to keep them happy! Low-noise and under control-fun is encouraged. The fine for parties will be an automatic charge equivalent to the security deposit.  - No smoking: the fine for smoking is 300. - No Pets: the fine for pets is 300.

name: Kensington Place Loft 202(C)
summary: Located in a building with multiple units that have undergone recent renovations. Central, downtown Toronto.   Kensington area is full of vibrant culture... there is art and famous graffiti artists everywhere, as well as shops and everything you'd want in a signature Bohemian neighborhood! Kensington has its own aura, people are kind & welcoming. There is fresh produce everywhere. Fresh Cheese shops galore!  Beautiful European bakeries.  Ideal for travelers with a taste for art & culture.
space: Fully renovated building & unit that is modern and comfortable.  The apartment is furnished and stocked with anything you would require.

Kensington area is full of vibrant culture... there is art and famous graffiti artists everywhere, as well as shops and everything you'd want in a signature Bohemian neighborhood! Kensington has its own aura, people are kind & welcoming. There is fresh produce everywhere. Fresh Cheese shops galore!  Beautiful European bakeries.  Ideal for travelers with a taste for art & culture. Fully renovated building & unit that is modern and comfortable.  The apartment is furnished and stocked with anything you would require. Shared with Laundry room, with 4 machines (no charge). Located deep in Kensington market, surrounded by plenty of street art, some of the best restaurants the city has to offer and the best local produce. neighborhood_overview: Located deep in Kensington market, surrounded by plenty of street art, some of the best restaurants the city has to offer and the best local produce.  You are centrally located in a most convenient part of the area, close to all the attractions Downtown Toronto has to offer - ROM Museum, CN Tower, Ripley's Aquarium, AGO, Chinatown, etc. Subway stations within walking distance, and two different streetcar routes are one minute away. The spadina streetcar will take you to the CN tower, harbour front, or the opposite direction towards the Bloor subway line. The College streetcar takes you to either Little Italy or Yonge Street.

Everything is within 5 to 10 minutes walking, grocery stores, movie theater, restaurants, performing Art Center, Toronto library, Finch subway and so much more. Surrounded by million dollar houses. Very fast growing popular area with demand for safety and convenience.
notes: Due to the huge space in the house, sometimes, there is echo through hallway.  Guests are to be aware of this fact and to be quiet after 10PM. The big kitchen is a good place to socialize but all guests are expected to be respectful and clean for the common space usage. No shoes inside the house. Indoor sleeper is preferred.
transit: - You can walk to Finch subway station (10 minutes) - 30 minutes to downtown Toronto by public transit  - Two blocks from Yonge Street one of the largest streets in the world - Close to Shoppers Drug Mart, Metro, H-mart, Starbucks, Loblaws, LCBO and many restaurants. - Beautiful Don Valley Park is 10 min away by TTC. - 20 minute drive to Vaughan Mills Outlet and Canada’s Wonderland, the largest amusement park in Canada. It's a 25 min drive from Pearson Airport. There's also an airport shuttle bus called GO leaving from Finch terminal every hour. By TTC (Toronto Transit Commission) it takes 1h30min. There are other options like Uber or Taxi which will cost around CAD35 and it takes 30 min from the airport.

Since I became AirBnB host, I had many wonderful guests. I want my guests to feel home here in Toronto, while they are away from home. 
Over the years of work, I ended up looking after a few other places, even not only my place but also my friends's places as they know I like working with houses. Especially renovating kitchen and washroom is my specialty. I love working with the patterns and colors of tiles.

name: Urban Oasis With Parking/ Hot Tub
summary: An urban oasis nestled between restaurants, shops, parks and the beach.
space: Our space is a beautiful family home in an area of Toronto just east of the downtown core - fully accessible by transit (24 hour street car) and by road.   It's a recently renovated gem with 2 bedrooms (each with comfy queen size beds), with lots of extra space and hidden nooks inside and out.  The main floor is defined by a modern, stainless steel kitchen (dishwasher, gas stove, refrigerator) at one end, high ceilings throughout, and a welcoming living space with a large full length window at the other end looking out into a garden.  The table easily seats 6, and the kitchen island will accommodate a further 3 more.  The living space is fitted with a comfortable couch, cozy rug and chair to gaze upon the gas fireplace at the end of the day, along with a stereo and many CDs to listen too while you enjoy the openness of the space.    Upstairs on the 2nd floor is the first bedroom, a stylist 4 piece bathroom and a library type room with lots of books to leaf through, and a collection of

Upstairs on the 2nd floor is the first bedroom, a stylist 4 piece bathroom and a li
neighborhood_overview: Toronto is very much a city of parks and neighborhoods.  Our home is very conveniently located at the centre of three neighborhoods - to the north, east and west with major parks and Lake Ontario to the south -  all within a 5 to 15 minute walk.   A short walk north on Woodfield to Gerrard Street and you will discover Little India with its numerous buffet restaurants and colorful clothing stores.  Try the Regency for a great Indian buffet.  One block north lies Queen Street one of the primary east-west streets in Toronto.  Walk east on Queen and you will hit the Beaches neighborhood, with many unique stores for shopping as well as a wide range of restaurants.  Just before Coxwell ave,  there is a delightful french bakery, Boulangerie and just past Coxwell there is a liquor store and movie theatre with multiple screens.  Further along is Whitlocks a superb restaurant about 30 minutes away and the only totally woodframed business building in the city.  For good pub food go to Lion on the
transit: There is a 24 hour street car that spans the entire city of Toronto from East to West.  Cost per ride is 3 Traffic on the East side of Toronto is much lighter than the city core and West side but allows easy access to the entire city by both Lakeshore Road and the Gardiner Expressway.
access: Guests will have access to the entire house except for 1 locked office and wine/liquor
interaction: We are available should you need anything whatsoever. If all you need is privacy, you've got it. :-)

notes: Please check with us before doing laundry. We charge 3 per load which includes the use of the washer, dryer, or drying rack, soap and dryer sheets. No shoes or odd items are allowed to be washed in the machines - normal fabric clothing only.
transit: There is 24 hour streetcar service. Two streetcars and one bus stop very close to our home. It is a 5 minute streetcar ride or a 15 minute walk to the subway. Street Parking Is Available. You can go online and order and print a temporary street parking permit from the Toronto City website.  We can help you access it when you arrive if you need. Transit Instructions from Pearson Airport: You can get the Pearson Express train to Union Station for 12. From Union Station, you can take an Uber Taxi for 6-8 or the TTC for 3.25, or you can walk. Transit Instructions from Union Station: Subway Line 1 to Queen Station 501 (Queen) Streetcar East to Tracy street (Tracy street is one stop past Parliament Street) Walk North to on Tracy Street to Shuter Street Walk West on Shuter Street to 369 Transit Instructions from Toronto Coach Terminal: 505 (Dundas) streetcar East to Regent Street Walk south on Regent street to Shuter.  Transit Instructions from Billy Bishop Airport: 310 (Bathurst) streetca

house_rules: We do not allow smoking in our home.  I expect guests be respectful of our home and our family and other guests. If you use any dishes, please wash, dry and put them away. Within a 10 minute walk you can be in Little Italy, Dundas West, Queen West, Parkdale, Liberty Village and Brockton Village. Lots of shopping at Dufferin Mall and Queen Street is the Fashion District. Trinity Bellwoods Park is just around the corner where many people love to spend their afternoons on a sunny day. The night life is bustling. Bars such as Lula Lounge for a night of Salsa, Lockhart ("The Harry Potter Bar") or Get Well for those who love Craft Beer. There is something for everyone in this area. You will love it here!
notes: If you are planning to bring a car you can park on the side streets for free until midnight. It's free on Dundas after 9pm until the morning rush hour (check the times). space: The unit is a private (entire unit) upper level of a split townhouse with 2 bedrooms, 1 washroom, fully stocked kitchen (with Nespresso Coffee maker), fireplace and laundry. The space is very cozy, bright and welcoming.   43" LCD Smart TV with Netflix and Youtube above the fireplace in the living room.  We've also just installed a Bluetooth sound bar for great sound when you're watching TV or stream from your bluetooth device (smart phones/laptops) and listen to your music. There is also a rooftop deck with a view of the city, patio table with 4 chairs and a BBQ.  Nice spot for hanging out on a hot summer day. Please note:  because this is an upper unit in a split town complex there are a lot of stairs.  The first flight upon entry takes you to the main living area, the bedrooms are on the second level and the rooftop patio on the 3rd.

host_about:
I used to be an avid graphic designer for a long time in Asia. I enjoy working with houses in Toronto as whole space seems to be a canvas to me. I like being the host and guests on this AirBnB as it is exciting meeting with lots of new people and keep upgrading my place to please the guests and myself. Since I became AirBnB host, I had many wonderful guests. I want my guests to feel home here in Toronto, while they are away from home. 
Over the years of work, I ended up looking after a few other places, even not only my place but also my friends's places as they know I like working with houses. Especially renovating kitchen and washroom is my specialty. I love working with the patterns and colors of tiles.

neighborhood_overview: This neighbourhood is surrounded by some of the best attractions Toronto has to offer. Like heights? CN Tower is minutes away. Want to go to a sports game or a concert? The Air Canada Centre and Rogers Centre are so close you can almost hear the crowds. Hungry? No problem! Tons great food options available, from fine dining to eating on a budget, its all so very close. Feel like going to the Harbour front? The lake is a 5 min walk from the condo! This location literally has it all! Its also less than 5 minutes walk to Metro Convention Centre!
notes: The swimming pool is not available.  Restaurants and Bars recommendation:  e11even - Modern American classics in a sophisticated space, plus a 3,200-bottle wine list. They are known for their truffled Mac and cheese, lobster Mac and cheese, the tuna tartare, and drink menu, their burgers are really good.  Azure- Polished hotel lobby restaurant with soaring windows, serving seasonal cuisine morning till night. Boasts private dining rooms, live jazz music and much more.  Epic - Upscale dining w/ seasonal Canadian cuisine w/ a wine list to write home about. Their sea food chowder, surf and turf and rack of lambs are known around the city! Real Sports Bar - Rated as the best sports bar in Toronto, this place boasts a 2-storey, high def screen for your viewing pleasure.  Miku - Japanese sushi restaurant close to the condo originated from Vancouver.
transit: Steps away from PATH and Union Station, Getting around without a car can't possibly get any easier.
access: You get to enjoy the entire condo.
interaction: Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

name: Kensington Place Loft 202(A)
summary: Located in a building with multiple units that have undergone recent renovations. Central, downtown Toronto.   Kensington area is full of vibrant culture... there is art and famous graffiti artists everywhere, as well as shops and everything you'd want in a signature Bohemian neighborhood! Kensington has its own aura, people are kind & welcoming. There is fresh produce everywhere. Fresh Cheese shops galore!  Beautiful European bakeries.  Ideal for travelers with a taste for art & culture.
space: Fully renovated building & unit that is modern and comfortable.  The apartment is furnished and stocked with anything you would require. Located deep in Kensington market, surrounded by plenty of street art, some of the best restaurants the city has to offer and the best local produce.  You are centrally located in a most convenient part of the area, close to all the attractions Downtown Toronto has to offer - ROM Museum, CN Tower, Ripley's Aquarium, AGO, Chinatown, etc. Subway stations within walking distance, and two different streetcar routes are one minute away. The spadina streetcar will take you to the CN tower, harbour front, or the opposite direction towards the Bloor subway line. The College streetcar takes you to either Little Italy or Yonge Street.

host_about:
Hey guys!  This business is new to me so be gentle.  I promise that I'll do my absolute best to accommodate your needs as a host.  I take your requests very seriously and respond to them as soon as I possibly can.  I also live about 10 minutes from this condo so if you need me to help you with anything, don't hesitate.

Aside from my apparent graciousness, I love travelling, good food and great music.  My favourite city in the world is Toronto (of course) but NYC is an extremely close second!  Some of my favourite movies are Bravehart, The Departed, Superbad, and Casino.  My favorite music is Jazz, Hippidy Hop, Indie and Latin (I know; mad consistent right?)  

My life motto:  SMILE.  Things are always better when you just smile more.  Not very complicated.  

Hope you guys choose my place to stay, next time you're in town!
street: Entertainment District, Toronto, ON M5V 0E9, Canada

name: Cozy Couple's Retreat minutes from downtown
summary: This is the perfect place for couples looking to explore Toronto together. Tucked away in High Park (one of Toronto's most affluent neighbourhoods) it is conveniently located and very private. We have fast WIFI and Egyptian Cotton sheets to ensure your stay is as comfortable as possible. Our studio apartment itself has everything you need to enjoy your stay from a kitchenette to in-unit laundry. We are just 13 minutes (5 minute walk and 7 minute train) from Union Station in the heart of Toronto.

transit: We are a 5 minute walk from the subway which makes getting around to see the best of Toronto convenient.   We are also a 5 minute walk from the Union-Pearson Express (UP) train which runs from Toronto's main airport to the main train station in the heart of the city.  It takes about 15 minutes to get right downtown into the action or to the airport so it's very convenient for transit.  Toronto also offers UberX and UberPool for inexpensive ways to travel with groups.

notes: The house is a shared space with 2 apartments above (separate units). They are other airbnb guests that you may see from time to time. Please respect the space as if it were your own. The apartment is freshly painted throughout, the kitchen is stocked with utensils&cookware, and the bathroom has all of your basic needs. Extra towels and sheets are provided. The basement is cool in the summer and stays warm during the winter! A dehumidifier is running 24/7 for your comfort.

Trash is picked up every 2nd Tuesday, alternating with the recycling schedule. Composting is also available-small green bins located in the wooden receptacle at the side of the house. Please do not put out food waste until garbage/compost pick up day, to deter critters like raccoons from making a mess. No smoking at any time in the unit or anywhere on the property. This is a healthy home. No pets. Please leave the apartment as it was upon check-in.

James and Julie

summary: Spacious Urban Apartment close to the Distillery District Located on the King Street Car Line, the entire city is at your fingertips. The space is very open and has everything you need for a great stay...including a park, right next door!
space: The apartment is above a business right on King Street East.  It has it's own entrance and complete privacy in the evening with no downstairs neighbors. The apartment is on two levels.  The kitchen, living room, dining room and office desk are on the 2nd floor. There are 2 bedrooms, the bathroom and deck are on the 3rd floor. The apartment is very spacious and will easily accommodate up to 6 people.  The third bed is a sofabed in the living room.  This will suit two children or smaller adults if necessary. The beds upstairs are both brand new, queen sized beds.  The master bedroom is very spacious and private. The second bedroom is semi private with a half wall but lots of light in the morning. The kitchen is large and fully stocked for making your own meals. There is a 55" TV in the living room with Apple TV and there is high speed internet throughout.

neighborhood_overview: South Corktown is a wonderful neighbourhood and a quick jumping ground to the entire city. To the South is the Distillery District with wonderful shops, bars, restaurants and cafes all set within the oldest Victorian Industrial Architecture in the country. A little to the East is the up and coming Riverdale and Leslieville.  Hipster bars and restaurants galore. To the west, Ryerson University and Chef School provides a backdrop to the design district.  Modern art and furniture. If you're looking to be in the core of the city, Yonge street is a mere 1500 metres away.
transit: There is a street car at your doorstep which brings you east or west. A couple of block up on Queen Street, there is a 24 hour street car which can bring you home in the wee hours.

neighborhood_overview: Riverside is Toronto’s authentic urban neighbourhood. Spanning 10 vibrant tree-lined blocks along Toronto’s historic Queen St. East from the iconic DVP Bridge to just east of the world famous Degrassi Street. Conveniently located between Corktown and Leslieville, Riverside is only 2.5 km from Toronto’s downtown core, and accessible via streetcar, bike, car or by foot. Riverside is home to historic sites, over 4 acres of parkland, 2 community centres, public art installations, festivals, schools, The Opera House, plus over 120 boutiques and services including original fashion creations, eclectic home design and décor, and plenty of trendy restaurants featuring award-winning chefs. We invite you to explore Riverside.
notes: We offer complete concierge service for  our guests, if you can think it, we can probably make it happen. neighborhood_overview: This neighbourhood is surrounded by some of the best attractions Toronto has to offer. Like heights? CN Tower is minutes away. Want to go to a sports game or a concert? The Air Canada Centre and Rogers Centre are so close you can almost hear the crowds. Hungry?? No problem! Tons and tons of great food options available, from fine dining to eating on a budget, it's all so very very close. Feel like going to the Harbour front? No problema! The lake is a 15 minute walk from the condo! This location literally has it all! It's also a two minute walk to the Metro Toronto Convention Centre!
notes: The building is brand new so there will be some construction in the main lobby and in and around the building.  The amenities will be plentiful to enjoy but won't be ready until later in 2016. I will keep you posted once they become available.  Looking for great food and entertainment? Don't sweat, we've got you covered! The building is minutes away from some of Toronto's finest and most talked about restaurants and bars: e11even - Updated American classics in a sophisticated space, plus a 3,200-bottle wine list. They're known for their truffled mac and cheese, lobster mac and cheese, the tuna tartare, and drinks menu, but you MUST try their burgers! One of the best in the city. Azure - Polished hotel lobby restaurant with soaring windows, serving seasonal cuisine morning till night. Boasts private dining rooms, live jazz music and much more. Epic - Upscale dining with seasonal Canadian cuisine with a wine list to write home about. Their sea food chowder, surf and turf and rack of lamb
transit: Steps away from PATH and Union Station, getting around without a car can't possibly get any easier.
access: The entire condo unit is yours to enjoy. FREE PARKING IS AVAILABLE !

host_about:
Hey guys!  This business is new to me so be gentle.  I promise that I'll do my absolute best to accommodate your needs as a host.  I take your requests very seriously and respond to them as soon as I possibly can.  I also live about 10 minutes from this condo so if you need me to help you with anything, don't hesitate.

Aside from my apparent graciousness, I love travelling, good food and great music.  My favourite city in the world is Toronto (of course) but NYC is an extremely close second!  Some of my favourite movies are Bravehart, The Departed, Superbad, and Casino.  My favorite music is Jazz, Hippidy Hop, Indie and Latin (I know; mad consistent right?)  

My life motto:  SMILE.  Things are always better when you just smile more.  Not very complicated.  

Hope you guys choose my place to stay, next time you're in town!

The unit itself boasts everything you need to feel right at home! Newly built one bedroom plus den, located in one of the best locations downtown Toronto has to offer.  Steps away from the CN Tower, Rogers Centre, Air Canada Centre, Ripley's Aquarium, Metro Toronto Convention Centre and much more!  If you're new  to the city, and want to explore some of Toronto's famous landmarks, this is the place for you!   Looking for great food and entertainment?  Don't sweat, we've got you covered!  The building is minutes away from some of Toronto's finest and most talked about restaurants and bars: e11even - Updated American classics in a sophisticated space, plus a 3,200-bottle wine list.  They're known for their truffled mac and cheese, lobster mac and cheese, the tuna tartare, and drinks menu, but you MUST try t
neighborhood_overview: This neighbourhood is surrounded by some of the best attractions Toronto has to offer.  Like heights?  CN Tower is minutes away.  Want to go to a sports game or a concert?  The Air Canada Centre and Rogers Centre are so close you can almost hear the crowds.  Hungry??  No problem!  Tons and tons of great food options available, from fine dining to eating on a budget, it's all so very very close.  Feel like going to the Harbour front?  No problema!  The lake is a 15 minute walk from the condo!  This location literally has it all!
transit: Steps away from PATH and Union Station, getting around without a car can't possibly get any easier.
access: The building is brand new and people are still moving in.  There is a huge list of amenities that include swimming pool, gym, party room, etc.
interaction: Guests can call me, text me, email me, (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) me, (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) me, Tweet me, BBM me (I think you get the point) anytime they please.  If there's something I can help you with, let me know and I'll do my best to accommodate you!
host_about:
Hey guys!  This business is new to me so be gentle.  I promise that I'll do my absolute best to accommodate your needs as a host.  I take your requests very seriously and respond to them as soon as I possibly can.  I also live about 10 minutes from this condo so if you need me to help you with anything, don't hesitate.

Aside from my apparent graciousness, I love travelling, good food and great music.  My favourite city in the world is Toronto (of course) but NYC is an extremely close second!  Some of my favourite movies are Bravehart, The Departed, Superbad, and Casino.  My favorite music is Jazz, Hippidy Hop, Indie and Latin (I know; mad consistent right?)  

My life motto:  SMILE.  Things are always better when you just smile more.  Not very complicated.  

Hope you guys choose my place to stay, next time you're in town!

neighborhood_overview: This is one of the fastest growing area in Toronto with lots of new condo buildings and new stores. The area is getting fancier everyday.  I updated the house inside as almost as new look with new furnishing, new washroom and kitchen.
notes: You will use one of three rooms. If you need two rooms, please ask Whitney on this email prior to your confirmation. We will make your stay as comfortable as it could be. We are using clean white linen and towel so please do not wash with other clothes to prevent stain.
transit: There is Sheppard  subway within 5 minutes walking and the major highway 401 access from Yonge street is within 3 minutes away. The subway leads you to downtown Toronto within 20 minutes.  Another new downtown Eglington subway station is only 3 more stops from Sheppard subway. From Pearson Airport/ There is direct bus, GO, number 34 at Pearson Airport to this area. Go bus has luggage compartment. Comfortable and fast with reasonable cost. The fare is  6.40. This bus will take you to this area about 30 to 40 minutes depending on traffic. There are a few stops on the way. You will get off at Yonge and Glendora stop. From Glendora stop to the house, it takes 5 minutes walking.  Uber Taxi will cost about 35 to 45 depending on traffic. From Sheppard subway / Take exit of Anndale at the Sheppard subway station as this exit takes you much quicker to the house.
access: There is fully equipped kitchen, washer and drier. Internet. Recently renovated clean washroom.
interaction: Whitney is living near by within 10 minutes driving away. Darius and Shalom  help guests as a co-host.  We are super nice friendly people. We have a great team to help guests' needs and request. This is almost new listing so we pay attention to improve the place with our best.
host_about:
I used to be an avid graphic designer for a long time in Asia. I enjoy working with houses in Toronto as whole space seems to be a canvas to me. I like being the host and guests on this AirBnB as it is exciting meeting with lots of new people and keep upgrading my place to please the guests and myself. Since I became AirBnB host, I had many wonderful guests. I want my guests to feel home here in Toronto, while they are away from home. 
Over the years of work, I ended up looking after a few other places, even not only my place but also my friends's places as they know I like working with houses. Especially renovating kitchen and washroom is my specialty. I love working with the patterns and colors of tiles.

name: Stylish Downtown Restful Bed
summary: One bed in a shared room.  This a beautifully renovated 1890's Victorian townhome that is located in one of the major up and coming neighbourhoods in the city and walking distance to all downtown attractions and amenities.
space: This lovely shared room offers a very economical option for the single traveler. You will get your own bed in the room (only one person per booking please). If you have a friend, they can book another bed separately. There are two other  beds in the room, for other Airbnb guests, so this is NOT PRIVATE. We also offer private rooms as another option - we can send you a link if you request. Our home is a beautifully renovated 1890's Victorian town home. We are located downtown on the Lower East Side in one of the major up and coming neighbourhoods in the city and walking distance to all downtown attractions and amenities.

Guests are welcome to access all public areas of the home. Amenities: high speed internet, iron. and light kitchen use. Laundry and parking are avail
neighborhood_overview: The Lower East Side is a beautiful downtown neighbourhood. You can walk or take short transit rides to the Eaton Centre, The Toronto Convention Centre, The Art Gallery of Ontario, Kensington Market, Chinatown, The Royal Ontario Museum, The Hockey Hall of Fame, The CN Tower, Bata Shoe Museum, Dundas Square, Distillery District, The Toronto Island Ferry, City Hall, The Theatre District, and so much more.
notes: Please check with us before doing laundry. We charge 3 per load which includes the use of the washer, dryer, or drying rack, soap and dryer sheets. No shoes or odd items are allowed to be washed in the machines - normal fabric clothing only.
transit: There is 24 hour streetcar service. Two streetcars and one bus stop very close to our home. It is a 5 minute streetcar ride or a 15 minute walk to the subway. Street Parking Is Available. You can go online and order and print a temporary street parking permit from the Toronto City website.  We can help you access it when you arrive if you need. Transit Instructions from Pearson Airport: You can get the Pearson Express train to Union Station for 12. From Union Station, you can take an Uber Taxi for 6-8 or the TTC for 3.25, or you can walk. Transit Instructions from Union Station: Subway Line 1 to Queen Station 501 (Queen) Streetcar East to Tracy street (Tracy street is one stop past Parliament Street) Walk North to on Tracy Street to Shuter Street Walk West on Shuter Street to 369 Transit Instructions from Toronto Coach Terminal: 505 (Dundas) streetcar East to Regent Street Walk south on Regent street to Shuter.  Transit Instructions from Billy Bishop Airport: 310 (Bathurst) streetca
access: Guests are welcome to access all public areas of the home. Amenities: high speed internet, iron. and light kitchen use. Laundry and parking are available for an extra fee.
interaction: We are happy to meet our guests and chat, or to give people their privacy so that they can work or relax alone. We love having people stay with us. It gives us the opportunity to meet all kinds of interesting travelers from around the world.
house_rules: We do not allow smoking in our home.  I expect guests be respectful of our home and our family and other guests. If you use any dishes, please wash, dry and put them away.

name: Charming Two Bedroom Apartment!
summary: Perfect for families or large groups, our place is on the second floor, right on Dufferin street in the heart of the action! It has a modern feel with beautiful hardwood flooring and exposed brick walls. The master bedroom has huge  windows letting in tonnes of natural light, and a huge semi private working area if you are in town for business.   The living room and dining area are spacious and the couch folds out into a Queen sized bed for 2 more guests.
space: We have equipped the apartment with everything you need to enjoy your stay including TV, a fully equipped kitchen and a cute living area. There are many restaurants in the area which are great options of you don't want to get your hands dirty.

I usually don't meet my guests in person unless you need me too but I am always quick to respond to qu
neighborhood_overview: Our cute apartment is located in the heart of Little Portugal, one of the fastest up-and-coming neighbourhoods in Toronto's downtown core. The neighbourhood is constantly growing more and more exciting with lots of awesome shops, cafes, AMAZING restaurants, and lots of entertainment! There's no shortage of fun things to do and great places to eat, all within a short walking distance.
notes: I always make sure to recommend my favourite restaurants in the area so my guests have lots of great options for eating out.
transit: The suite is about a 30 metre walk from Dundas Street which has a light-rail train or "streetcar" which is part of the city's subway and transit system. This makes it very easy to get around the city and see all the best attractions and areas in the city. It is also a short 10 minute walk from Queen West, the place to shop in Toronto with cute boutiques and stores where you can find anything you can imagine.
access: Gusts have access to the entire apartment, there are no shared areas.
interaction: Consider me your 5-Star Concierge. I am available from 8AM-12PM answering guest inquiries ASAP (usually 5 minutes or less). I usually don't meet my guests in person unless you need me too but I am always quick to respond to questions.
house_rules: - Our Space: please be respectful of our space and treat it as your own.   - No Parties: We want you to enjoy your stay with us as much as possible, but we love our neighbours and want to keep them happy! Low-noise and under control-fun is encouraged. The fine for parties will be an automatic charge equivalent to the security deposit.  - No smoking: the fine for smoking is 300. - No Pets: the fine for pets is 300.
